achievements.toGoForNextLevel: to go for the next level
achievements.noAchievementsGainedYet: No achievements have been collected yet.

commands.title: Commands
commands.prefixCanBeChanged: The prefix `!` of these commands can be changed in the 'My servers' page after you login.
commands.canUseInDirectMessage: You can also use most of these commands on the direct message to RinBot, in order to play a private session. Points gained in this way are not counted for the leaderboards.

rounds.title: #### Rounds
rounds.sga: **Starts a round with audio fragments of opening and ending songs**
rounds.sgvn:
**Starts a round with images of visual novels**  
Only the difficulty filter works for this command.
rounds.sb: **Start a multiple-choice button round with images**
rounds.stopg:
**Stops the current round**  
This command is limited to once every 15 minutes per person, to prevent abuse. [Patrons get a reduced cooldown](https://patreon.com/rinbot?fan_landing=true)!

voiceRounds.title: #### Voice round sessions
voiceRounds.sgs:
**Start a voice round session**  
This will join a voice channel (with the same name, or the one that you are in) and then start doing rounds.  
Make sure that RinBot has __Connect__ and __Speak__ permissions for the channel.
voiceRounds.sgsa: **Start a voice round session with samples**
voiceRounds.sbsa: **Start a multiple-choice button voice round session with samples**
voiceRounds.stopgs:
**Stop voice rounds**  
This will stop the voice rounds mode and the current round as well.

shortcuts.title:
#### Round filter shortcuts  
These are some quick filters to start out with. Difficulty is picked automatically based on your current points if none is specified
shortcuts.year:
**Starts a new round from year `[year]` up to now**  
Example: `!sg 1999` would pick anime from the years 1999 up to and including the current year
shortcuts.years:
**Starts a new round from the years between `[year1]` and `[year2]`**  
Example: `!sg 1999 2003` would pick anime from the years 1999 up to and including 2003
shortcuts.difficulty:
**Starts a new round with a specific difficulty**  
1 (easy), 2 (normal), 3 (hard), 4 (extreme), 5 (nightmare) and 0 (everything)  
Example: `!sg 1` for an easy round, or `!sg 4` for an extreme one.
shortcuts.genre:
**Starts a new round with anime from a specific genre**  
Use command `!genres` for a list of all available genres.
shortcuts.songType:
**Starts a new audio round with songs of a specific type**  
Song type can be: `op` (openings), `ed` (endings), `in` (insert songs) or `tm` (image songs)
shortcuts.query:
**Starts a new round with anime based on your own query**  
`d:1` to add difficulty to the filter  
`g:shounen` to add a genre to the filter  
`y:2001-2009` to add a year range to the filter  
`t:op` to add song type to filter (only for `!sga` rounds)  
Example: `!sg d:1 g:shounen y:2001-2009` or `!sg g:drama y:2010` or `!sga t:op`  
_Note that you do NOT have to use all of the filters in your queries._

queries.title:
### Queries  
You can build your own queries with these parameters. They will work for `!sg`, `!sgv`, `!sga`, `!sgs` and `!sgsa`.  

For example: `!sg n:5 d:3 y:1995-2005` to start a session with 5 rounds of anime on hard difficulty between the years 1995 and 2005.
queries.numberOfRounds:
**The number of rounds in a session**  
This will automatically start multiple rounds in one session, and gives you a leaderboard at the end of the session.  
Example: `n:2` for 2 rounds to a maximum of 10 rounds with `n:10`
queries.imageManipulations:
**Manipulates images in a round** (only for rounds with images)  
You can choose from `p` pixelated, `i` inverted, `o` oil-painted, `g` grayscale, `f` flipped vertically.  
Example: `im:p` or a combination with `im:g,o,i`
queries.difficulty:
**Filter the difficulty**  
1 (easy), 2 (normal), 3 (hard), 4 (extreme), 5 (nightmare) and 0 (everything)  
Example: `d:1` for an easy round, or `d:4` for an extreme one and `d:0` to disable the difficulty filter.
queries.genre:
**Filter the genre**  
Currently only a single genre can be filtered, like `g:action` or `g:horror`.  
Use command `!genres` for a list of all available genres.
queries.songType:
**Filter the type of songs** (`!sga`, `!sgs` and `!sgsa` only)  
Song type can be: `op` (openings), `ed` (endings), `in` (insert songs) or `tm` (image songs)
queries.year:
**Filter the year**  
Example: `y:1999` would pick anime from the years 1999 up to and including the current year  
`y:2005-2010` would pick between the years 2005 and 2010 (both inclusive)
queries.mal:
**Filter based on your MyAnimeList**  
Example: `mal:username` or `mal:user1,user2` for multiple user lists.  
You need to have used the `!sync` command first, before you can use the filter.
queries.anilist:
**Filter based on your AniList**  
Example: `anilist:username` or `anilist:user1,user2` for multiple user lists.  
You need to have used the `!sync` command first, before you can use the filter.   
You can also combine different kinds of anime lists together, like this: `mal:user1,user2 anilist:user3`
queries.aggr:
**Aggregation method** (only when using anime list filters)  
You can use `aggr:union` to unite the anime lists instead of intersecting them.

points.title:
#### Points  
These are recalculated every hour. You can [boost your server](https://patreon.com/rinbot?fan_landing=true) for real-time updates.
points.myscore: **Shows the points you gained and rounds you played in the current channel**
points.serverscore: **Shows the score of the whole server**
points.alltop: **Shows the top players of all time in the server**
points.allfastest:
**Shows the fastest players of all time in the server**  
Only rounds with an anime pool of more than 1000 are counted.
points.weektop:
**Shows the top players of the current week in the server**  
It uses ISO-8601 weeks of the year with Monday as the first day in the week. The command will tell you when the week will reset.
points.weekfastest:
**Shows the fastest players of the current week in the server**  
Only rounds with an anime pool of more than 1000 are counted.  
For example: this will exclude easy/normal modes and most smaller genres.

ctop.title: #### Custom leaderboards
ctop.ctop: **Show the custom leaderboard for the current channel**
ctop.startctop:
**Starts a new custom leaderboard for the channel**  
You need to use multiple channels to have multiple custom leaderboards at the same time.
ctop.endctop:
**End the active custom leaderboard**  
This stops points from being accumulated, but does not remove the leaderboard.
ctop.resetctop:
**Resets the custom leaderboard**  
This will **completely delete** the custom leaderboard, never to return again!  
To use this feature you need one of the following permissions:
- Administrator
- Manage Server
- Manage Roles
- Manage Channels
- Manage Messages

misc.title: #### Miscellaneous
misc.statg: **Show some global statistics of the game**
misc.sync:
**Synchronize your anime list from other sites**  
Currently MyAnimeList and AniList are supported.
misc.credits: **Shows you all the cool people and websites that are helping to make {botName} possible.**
misc.mydifficulty: **Lets you set the default difficulty for all rounds you start.**

management.title: #### Management
management.prefix: **Shows you the current prefix and lets you change it**
management.lang: **Shows you the current language and lets you change it**

onlyForPatrons.description: **Can only be used by [patrons]({patreonUrl})** - this was introduced to reduce the server load, and have people help pay the bills

isExperimental.description: **Experimental feature** - this feature is quite new, so might contain some bugs [please report them here]({supportServerUrl}) if you find some

slashCommands.title: Slash commands
slashCommands.description:
In order to use the slash commands you will possibly need to re-invite {botName} and make sure she has the **Create commands in a server** scope.  
You can use the invite button on the home page, or by clicking {botName} from within Discord.  

Make sure your users have the permission **Use Application Commands**, or they won't be able to use any slash commands at all.

ephemeral.description: **Ephemeral command** - the messages following these commands will be visible only to you.

introduction.title: {botName}'s homepage
introduction.shortDescription: Play **guess the anime** and many other guessing quiz games directly in discord channels with your friends.
introduction.orSeeHerInAction: or you can see her in action in the
introduction.checkTheCommandListAndConfigure: Check the command list for a full list of features. You can configure {botName} after logging on this website, to customize her to the needs of your server.
introduction.features:
### Features
- **Thousands** of anime, characters, visual novels and video games available to guess!
- Guess from images, video clips or audio fragments of songs.
- **Randomly picked captures** makes no round ever the same.
- **Scoring system with leaderboards** (all-time, weekly and your own custom periods)
- Multiple **difficulty levels**, so even new fans of anime and visual novels can have fun.
- Titles can be guessed in **multiple languages**.
- ‚Ä¶and much more!

overview.title: Overview
overview.guildsHiddenByDefault: By default server names are hidden, login as server admin to show it.

players.title: Players
players.description: This is a list of top players across all servers the game is being played on. Direct message rounds are not counted.

guilds.title: Servers
guilds.description:
This is a list of the top servers the game is being played on.  
By default your server's name will be hidden. You can choose to show it in the server configuration after you login.

achievements.title: Achievements
achievements.description: This is of the players that have collected the most achievement points.

needHelp.supportServerIntroduction: You can ask for help, give feedback, request new features or just play some Guess the Anime in the official support server.
needHelp.encounterProblemsContact: If you encounter any problems at all, please contact Kururin there.

myBoostedServers.youCannotBoostServers:
# You cannot boost any servers  
You need to at least be a tier 2 patron to be able to boost a server.  
To get this, first link your Discord account to patreon, and then [pledge for at least tier 2 at RinBot's patreon page]({patreonLink}).
myBoostedServers.boostedServers:
# Boosted servers  
You are a tier {patronTier} patron. You can boost {boostsLeft} more server(s)

myServers.title: My servers
myServers.description: You need to have the **Server Management** permission to be able to configure {botName} for your server.

disableLegacyCommands.description: This will disable the legacy prefixed commands completely, so you will only be able to use slash commands.
disableLegacyCommands.label: Prefixed commands

prefix.description: These characters will be put infront of commands instead of the default: !
prefix.label: Command prefix
prefix.invalid: This is a required field and must be between 1 and 5 characters.

language.description: Sets the language for RinBot within Discord. This does not affect the anime titles.
language.label: Language

showInLeaderboards.description: When this is enabled your server's name will be shown in the server leaderboards. It may take an hour for this change to be propagated.
showInLeaderboards.checkbox: Show server's name in the global leaderboards on this site
showInLeaderboards.label: Show in global leaderboards

inviteCode.description: Invite code that is used for the URL for your server's name in the leaderboards
inviteCode.label: Invite code
inviteCode.invalid: This invite code seems to be invalid

managementRoles.label: Management roles
managementRoles.description: Roles that will have access to manage the bot through this page. Users with the 'Server management' permission already have access.

animeSummaryLink.description: This only changes the URL and it may fallback to the RinBot website for some anime.
animeSummaryLink.label: Anime summary link

hideAlternativeTitles.description: Checking this will hide the list of alternative titles in the anime summary.
hideAlternativeTitles.label: Alternative titles

showMissingPlayersInLeaderboards.description: Check this will make players who have left the server still show up in the leaderboards. It may take up to an hour for them to appear.
showMissingPlayersInLeaderboards.label: Missing players in leaderboards

disableSummaryLink.description: Checking this will remove the link from the summary at the end of a round.
disableSummaryLink.label: Summary

disableDrops.description: Checking this will make the game not spawn any random character drops.
disableDrops.label: Drops

disableHints.description: Checking this will make the game not show any hints in any rounds at all.
disableHints.label: Hints

enableAntiSpam.description: Enabling this will make the bot start ignoring players who try to guess using the same title continuously.
enableAntiSpam.label: Anti-spam

titlePreferences.description:
##### Title preferences  
Here you can configure your preferences in title languages that should be accepted as correct guesses.  

If your preferences result in an empty set of titles it will fallback to the defaults.

percentageWrong.label: Percentage wrong
percentageWrong.description: {percentage}% - lower means less forgiving against typo's in guesses

disableTitleSimplifications.description: Disables title simplifications (such as splitting long titles on their dash/colon and removing common contextual words as 'season', 'version', etc)
disableTitleSimplifications.label: Title simplfications

mainTitle.label: Main title
mainTitle.description: This is the priority in which main titles will be chosen. The main title is the one used for the hint and the anime summary at the end of a round. If no main title can be found based on your preferences, it will fallback to defaults.

winnerRoleConfigs.label: Roles by rank
winnerRoleConfigs.title: Role configuration
winnerRoleConfigs.description: Here you can set up role assignments for winners in the leaderboard.
winnerRoleConfigs.permissionInfo: Make sure {botName} has the 'Manage Roles' permission and is positioned above the role that you want to let her assign.
winnerRoleConfigs.reachedMaximumAssignments: You have reached the maximum of {maxWinnerRoleConfigs} role assignments.
winnerRoleConfigs.boostedServersGetMoreAssignments: [Boosted servers]({patreonLink}) can have up to {patronWinnerRoleConfigs} role assignments.
winnerRoleConfigs.warnManagedRole: Note that the roles will be completely managed by {botName}, so any members of the role that are not winners will be removed.

roundButtonConfig.label: Round buttons
roundButtonConfig.description: Buttons that are checked will show up at the end of rounds and session

channelConfiguration.description: Here you can configure a few specific options per-channel. These might be extended with more of the server configuration options at a later date.
channelConfiguration.noChannelsConfigured: No channels have been configured at the moment. Click the 'Add a channel' button to start.
channelConfiguration.maximumReached: You have reached the maximum of {maxChannelConfigs} channel configurations.
channelConfiguration.boostedServersGetMore: [Boosted servers]({patreonLink}) can have up to {patronMaxConfigs} channel configurations.

startGameOnIdle.checkbox: Start a new round when channel is idle

useForVoiceRounds.checkbox: Use only this voice channel for voice rounds (only one can be active)

channelAccessControlEnabled.description: This will make {botName} not listen to any commands unless whitelisted specifically per channel.
channelAccessControlEnabled.label: Access control

supportUs.supportThroughPatreon: If you would like to help cover the server costs, you can pledge any amount you want using Patreon. You will also gain some special perks!
supportUs.goal: {completedPercentage}% of the ${amount} per month operational costs are funded!
supportUs.supportThroughKoFi: You might also consider buying me a coffee through ko-fi.com. However, this does not give any perks other than my utmost appreciation!
supportUs.helpWithTranslating: You can help by improving current translations or adding new languages using crowd-translation!
supportUs.joinTheTranslationsChannel: Be sure to join the `#translations` channel in [the support server]({supportServerUrl}) to ask for help and discuss translations.
supportUs.signInWithAuth0: Sign in with Auth0 and then 'Continue with Discord'.
supportUs.supportThroughVoting: Always helpful is voting regularly and leaving a review on these websites.

notLoggedIn: You need to be logged in to access this page.

status.title: Status
status.description: Here you can find the status of some of the services that make {botName} work as she should. This page automatically refreshes every 10 seconds.

website.name: Website
website.tooltip: You wouldn't be here if this one was red

api.name: API
api.tooltip: Provides dynamic content and bot configuration on the website

graphql.name: GraphQL
graphql.tooltip: Provides dynamic content (such as the database) on the website

worker.name: Worker
worker.tooltip: Provides leaderboard, score and profile updates

status.putYourServerId: Put your server ID here to find your shard
status.couldNotGetShardStatuses: Could not get shard statuses from API
status.howToFindYourServerId: If you don't know how to find your server's ID, please [read this support article](https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/206346498-Where-can-I-find-my-User-Server-Message-ID-).

main.isBetaSite: You are currently browsing the {botName} beta website. This is only meant for testing purposes. [Click here to browse the actual website]({productionUrl}).
main.isAinaBotSite: You are currently browsing AinaBot's homepage. This is a discord bot with only adult content. [Click here to go to RinBot's homepage]({productionUrl}), which has regular anime.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: The amount of rounds played per day for the past 30 days.

channelAccessControlConfig.title: Access control
channelAccessControlConfig.description:
Access control rules are processed from top to bottom.  
Everything is denied by default, so you will have to make one allow rule at the very least.
channelAccessControlConfig.maximumReached: You have reached the maximum number of access controls.

reportAnime.couldNotSubmit: Your report could not be submitted.

validation.maxLength: Maximum length is {max} characters, but you wrote {length} characters.

hideNameGlobally.description:
Enabling this will set your name as '(hidden)' on all leaderboards and profiles within the website.
  Your change may take up to a day to be implemented throughout the system.
